poem.title: I am Fed Up with Beautiful Women
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
Gravity (patiently) pleats The jungles. Burning peats Relate their ancient summers Incoherently. This piece will not fare better.
There is nothing nonchalant about you. Brightness older than the hills Flares up in you, And you don't quite get it.
No peace between why not And why. You hold my glance And pierce the routine. It's time To go. How grey the fierce Feast has made me.
What peaks, what stars, what beauties Will just have to do without me. Commit this to verse, It's a car-crusher requiem.
